alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 11:42PM CST until February 27 at 4:40PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Lamar and Marion. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hamilton, Winfield, Haleyville, Sulligent, Guin, Hackleburg, Brilliant, Detroit, Beaverton, Gu-Win, Weston, Brinn, Crews, Lake Buttahatchee, Lamar County Airport, Bedford, Bear Creek, Twin, Pikeville and Marion County Public Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
